alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 7:29AM CDT until October 26 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Tom Green. This includes the city of San Angelo * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Christoval, Lake Nasworthy, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Knickerbocker, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Tankersley, Wall, San Angelo State Park and Grape Creek. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, 1500 Block of Spaulding, 300 block of North Archer, Huntington and Sunset, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Huntington and Sunset and Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
